name: The 1920s:  Part II Quiz | Nostalgia | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 1923 confectioner Frank C. Mars had a hit with his first candy bar. What was it?
Where were the 1928 summer Olympics held?
questions.explanation:
Amsterdam.

	The winter games were held in St. Moritz.

questions.text: In the 1920s who established the first Soviet forced labor camp?
questions.explanation:
Lenin.

	He nationalized factories and seized farm products.

The Lone Eagle.

	He was an American aviator and a Pulitzer Prize winner.

questions.text: Bill Robinson was known as Mr. Bojangles. What did he do in the entertainment field?
questions.explanation:
Tap Dancer.

	He was one of the first black entertainers to achieve popularity among members of different races.

questions.text: The first sound cartoon was in 1928. Can you name it?
questions.explanation:
Steamboat Willie.

	It was the first cartoon with music and the second starring Mickey Mouse.

questions.text: How much did Model T Fords sell for in 1924?
What was the first nationwide radio network?
questions.explanation:
NBC.

	NBC also took the first step in the developement of TV in 1924. Pioneered color programming in 1954.

questions.text: 'Mein Kampf' was written by Hitler in his mountain hideaway?
questions.explanation:
False.

	The first volume was written in prison,the second volume after his release.

questions.text: Who was exiled from Russia in 1928?
questions.explanation:
Trotsky.

	He was exiled to Soviet Central Asia and in 1929 ordered to leave the USSR altogether. He lived first in Turkey, then France, Norway, and Mexico.
